H0.text: where is the thames river source. Cotswolds

H1.text: where is the thames river source. Chiltern Hills

H2.text: where is the thames river source. Oxfordshire

H3.text: where is the thames river source. Thames Head

A4.text: Thames Head is a group of seasonal springs that arise in the Cotswolds, in the county of Gloucestershire, England.

A5.text: The Environment Agency, the Ordnance Survey and other authorities have the source of the Thames as Thames Head.

A6.text: Seven Springs near Cheltenham, where the Churn (which feeds into the Thames near Cricklade) rises, is also sometimes quoted as the Thames' source.

A7.text: The springs at Seven Springs flow throughout the year, while those at Thames Head are seasonal (a winterbourne).
